topic.title: Star Wars Graf Archive update
topic.body:
I've had a good reception to the first release of A New Hope, it has a few seeders now I'm going to start a monthly release sechedule.

01 2018-05-25 - A New Hope - RELEASED

magnet:?xt=urn:btih:5d1e34df6b2b77b0fb48230b2cb4c51939c956bf&dn=Star+Wars+-+Graf+Archive+Digital+Preservation+Project+1&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.leechers-paradise.org%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fzer0day.ch%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fopen.demonii.com%3A1337&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Ftracker.coppersurfer.tk%3A6969&tr=udp%3A%2F%2Fexodus.desync.com%3A6969

02 2018-06-25 - The Empire Strikes Back
03 2018-07-25 - Return of the Jedi
04 2018-08-25 - The Phantom Menace
06 2018-09-25 - Attack of the Clones
07 2018-10-25 - Revenge of the Sith
08 2018-11-25 - The Force Awakens
09 2018-12-25 - Rogue One
10 2019-01-25 - The Last Jedi
11 2019-02-25 - Solo

Sometimes, there will be a .1 release consisting of minor sections including stuff like Shadows of the Empire, Knights of the Old Republic, the TV series, Ewok movies, official and unofficial magazines, reference books, fan club items, etc.  As updates to releases are posted with additions and/or replacements, they will be accompanied with instructions for how the files should be combined.  All links will be posted with each subsequent release so new users can get caught up.

If you have any questions or want to keep tabs of how it is going, join the GrafArchive channel or send me a personal message.

Contact Methods:            
My personal addres is BM-2cVTWmArYfjdMKq9hssEUi55Xf7G4PYSb9
Channel is GrafArchive BM-2cUM94Pq2jriryDt87Z3aTJL77Wg6Q1FBm

topic.title: How to run a namecoin full node Linux Ubuntu 18.04
topic.body:
Hello i have the possibility to help out and run such node . 
I need instructions please .
Thank you.

1522450733_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rY.body:
i paid out trust.zone vpn .
was doin' good and also they accep bitcoin .

> [dondothesupa](#comment_2_1dkd8ar9EaD5M6XLkxyQu1zwJhfhAd23H): It's, like, very funny to read something about VPSYou are silly? A lot of VPS providers ask your phone number (!). And if it is very good provider and it accepts monero or smth, it is same as VPN, 'cause they also can log your internet traffic. But VPS is even less private (!), 'cause you recently have just one static IP, ISP (government) can just connect it with you. Thats why you shouldn't buy and use VPS, instead use VPN + Tor connections.

> [dondothesupa](#comment_2_1dkd8ar9EaD5M6XLkxyQu1zwJhfhAd23H): It's, like, very funny to read something about VPSYou are silly? A lot of VPS providers ask your phone number (!). And if it is very good provider and it accepts monero or smth, it is same as VPN, 'cause they also can log your internet traffic. But VPS is even less private (!), 'cause you recently have just one static IP, ISP (government) can just connect it with you. Thats why you shouldn't buy and use VPS, instead use VPN + Tor connections.

the cheapest vps i found is sol vps .

There's a year-old project called peercloud that might scratch that itch:
* https://github.com/jhiesey/peercloud

* https://peercloud.io/

1521308711_128dbVaHobAMsFW25rUVyFxwdCvvf.body:
i can't do it i have a 403 error while connecting from a diffrent ip 
wanditoast@zeroid.bit

Ok I set uipassword and multiuser . So as I start zeronet.exe internet explorer starts and connects to it. So I set internet explorer in offline mode and I first connect to it though my web address. 
So the proxy keeps the networks binding to my external IP .
You can try it wanditoast.ddns.net

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: Do you know if a max capacity is set to zeronet ?

Run it in debug mode and look whats the control port zeronet try to connect and after change your config file in tor set controlport *

1569204638_1LJMKSLPgM8fqQSMRrLzWB2DhVm1z.body:

Okay then from source with the git cmands ?

> [d14na](#comment_96_1EAD2zXkzgJf6M7xQ4jG5FHCxUTez9NJJ4): Here are the build instructionshttps://github.com/namecoin/namecoin-core/blob/master/doc/build-unix.md [...]

Once it's installed I did this = ~/namecoind -daemon
Do you think is running propertly ?

> [d14na](#comment_98_1EAD2zXkzgJf6M7xQ4jG5FHCxUTez9NJJ4): after ~/namecoind -daemon, you can test using the CLI namecoin-cli getblockchaininfo

"chain": "main",
  "blocks": 472246,

> [d14na](#comment_100_1EAD2zXkzgJf6M7xQ4jG5FHCxUTez9NJJ4): yep, you're good!
